Home.title: Transform Your Smile. Transform Your Life.

image.alt: Smiling patient in modern orthodontic office showing straight teeth

paragraphs.text: Let Your Smile Shine. Dr. James Frazier and the team at Frazier Orthodontics understand the power of a confident, beautiful smile. We’d be honored to help you transform your life with a smile that reflects your personality and lights up every room.

Advanced Technology. Exceptional Smiles. We proudly use Damon® Smile and Damon® Clear systems, and offer SPARK™ and Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners — all tailored to fit your lifestyle and smile goals.

paragraphs.text: Dr. James Frazier is a specialist in Orthodontics and Dentofacial Orthopedics. He earned his DMD at the University of Pennsylvania and completed his orthodontic residency (MS) at the University of Illinois at Chicago. Dr. Frazier treats children, teens, and adults with individualized plans using modern technology to deliver comfortable, predictable treatment, and he brings a community-focused approach to every patient interaction.
From clear aligners to self-ligating braces and digital scanning, we offer options to fit different lifestyles and treatment goals.

image.alt: Spark™ clear aligner on model teeth
iTero® digital scanner being used for a digital impression

Home.title: Patient Testimonials
Home.review_text: Read more reviews on our Testimonials page

testimonials.author: Lynn T.
testimonials.testimonial: “Two of our children received braces from Frazier Orthodontics. The results are wonderful; they both have beautiful new smiles. The entire process was done very efficiently with convenient office hours, punctual services, and a length of treatment exactly what Dr. Frazier predicted. Dr. Frazier and his entire staff were always professional, caring, and very efficient. A great experience with wonderful results!”

testimonials.author: Dana F.
testimonials.testimonial: “It was a wonderful experience being a patient at Frazier Orthodontics. The entire staff was nice, caring, and knowledgeable. Dr. Frazier was great in explaining in detail my case and the process I needed to complete to get my desired results. Thanks to Dr. Frazier and his staff, I have a wonderful smile that I show every day! Thank you so much!!”

testimonials.author: Elissa B.
testimonials.testimonial: “Our family could not have asked for a better experience than what we had with Dr. Frazier and his staff. My teenaged son and daughter both agree that they had a great experience. I can only describe Dr. Frazier and his staff as professional, experienced, accommodating, and patient. Thanks for giving my children wonderful smiles!”

image.alt: Parents with kids relaxing in front of home

og_meta.title: Frazier Orthodontics — Transform Your Smile
og_meta.description: Frazier Orthodontics in River Forest, IL offers Damon® and Invisalign® treatments, digital scanning, and caring, personalized orthodontic care.

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in the Lakeshore Orthodontics office lobby

paragraphs.text: At Frazier Orthodontics our mission is to deliver top-quality, personalized orthodontic care in a warm, patient-centered environment. We focus on clear communication and a comfortable experience from the first consultation through retention.

We combine leading-edge orthodontic technology with compassionate service to create healthy, confident smiles for children, teens, and adults across River Forest, Oak Park, and the greater Chicago area.

Our team provides transparent treatment options, including braces and Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, flexible scheduling, and support with insurance and payment plans so care is convenient and affordable for every family.
Through individualized treatment plans, gentle techniques, and a friendly office atmosphere, we aim to help each patient leave our practice with not only a better smile, but also greater confidence.

Dr. James Frazier, DMD, MS, founded Frazier Orthodontics in 1999 and brings decades of experience treating patients of all ages. He emphasizes a patient-first approach, designing treatment plans that fit each person’s goals and lifestyle.

Dr. Frazier uses modern systems and digital workflows, including iTero scans, clear aligner treatment, and contemporary bracket systems, to deliver efficient, comfortable care with predictable results.

image.alt: Dr. Frazier consulting with a patient

paragraphs.text: Dr. Frazier earned his Doctor of Dental Medicine (DMD) at the University of Pennsylvania and completed a Master of Science in Oral Sciences at the University of Illinois at Chicago. His training underpins a commitment to evidence-based, modern orthodontic care.

image.alt: Dr. Frazier in the treatment room

paragraphs.text: Outside the office Dr. Frazier enjoys travel with his family, walking Chicago’s lakefront with his dogs, and supporting local causes such as the Animal Care League in Oak Park. He values community connection and looks forward to helping neighbors achieve healthier, more confident smiles.

Dr. Frazier is passionate about giving back to the River Forest community. The practice supports local organizations such as the Animal Care League in Oak Park and runs a patient referral program to thank families who recommend friends. If you have a community event or school program, please reach out to discuss partnership opportunities.

image.alt: Graphic representing community support by Lakeshore Orthodontics

og_meta.title: About Us | Frazier Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Personalized, modern orthodontic care from Dr. James Frazier serving River Forest, Oak Park, and the Chicago area.

image.alt: Dr. James Frazier with a patient (hero)

paragraphs.text: Your first visit to Frazier Orthodontics is a complimentary consultation with Dr. Frazier. We review your dental and medical history, take diagnostic photos and a panoramic X‑ray, and perform a thorough oral exam to assess your orthodontic needs.

We use an advanced 3D iTero digital scan for an interactive view of your teeth and bite and then discuss treatment options, financing, and insurance. After outlining a personalized plan, we can often begin treatment the same day when appropriate. Ready to schedule? Request your free consultation online at https://www.frazierorthodontics.com/appointment-request or call (708) 366‑6595.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We will work with you to create a payment plan that fits your individual budget. Our practice accepts credit and debit cards, and we offer flexible payment options to spread treatment costs.

If your insurance covers any portion of orthodontic care, we will file and process claims on your behalf. We work with many major providers, including MetLife, Aetna, United Concordia, Guardian, Cigna, Delta Dental, Humana, Blue Cross/Blue Shield, and United Healthcare. For questions or to schedule your complimentary consultation, call (708) 366‑6595.

Please complete patient intake forms before your first appointment to help us deliver safe, personalized care. You can download the appropriate medical/dental history form or submit information online prior to your visit.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

seo.page_description: Start your journey to a confident smile with a complimentary consultation at Frazier Orthodontics. Find forms, insurance info, and schedule online.

og_meta.title: Get Started | Frazier Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your journey to a confident smile with a complimentary consultation at Frazier Orthodontics. Find forms, insurance info, and schedule online.

paragraphs.text: Two‑phase (early) orthodontic treatment maximizes the opportunity for an ideal, stable result by combining tooth straightening with guidance of jaw growth. Early treatment can prevent the need for extractions or later surgery and helps create room for permanent teeth to erupt properly. Phase One commonly uses expanders and partial braces; after a resting and eruption period, Phase Two aligns all permanent teeth with full braces.

Phase One focuses on guiding jaw growth and creating space for permanent teeth, often with expanders or partial braces. After an eruption period we begin Phase Two to align all permanent teeth with comprehensive braces, helping reduce complexity and treatment time later.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: Benefits include correcting and guiding jaw growth, creating room for crowded permanent teeth, and reducing the chance of extractions or orthognathic surgery later. Records typically include models, X‑rays, and photographs to build an individualized plan.
Early intervention often makes later phases simpler and shorter, with predictable improvements after Phase One and a smooth transition to comprehensive care when permanent teeth arrive.

Orthodontic treatment is not just for teens. Adults can benefit from modern braces and clear aligners to correct crowding, gaps, and bite issues. Treatment times typically range from one to three years depending on severity and chosen method; patient cooperation, including wearing aligners or following elastic protocols, plays a major role in success.
We offer options suited to adult lifestyles: Damon® braces, Damon® Clear, Spark™, and Invisalign<sup>®</sup>. iTero® digital scans replace goop impressions for comfort and precision.

“I had been conscious of the spaces between my teeth for years... I only had the braces on for 18 months. By this time, in my late 40s, that 18 months went by quickly. I’m pleased with the results.” — Paul T.

We offer advanced passive self‑ligating Damon® systems, including Damon Smile and Damon Ultima™. These tie‑less brackets use a sliding mechanism that reduces friction and force, enabling gentler, often faster tooth movement with fewer adjustments and improved comfort.
The tie‑less design reduces the need for elastic ties, lowers treatment forces, and can mean fewer office visits and a more comfortable experience while delivering precise results.
Ceramic options blend with tooth color for a less noticeable look without sacrificing effectiveness, giving teens and adults a discreet choice.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens with braces

paragraphs.text: Frazier Orthodontics is a certified Invisalign<sup>®</sup> provider. Clear aligners made from SmartTrack® material offer a nearly invisible, removable option suitable for many cases, including crowding, crossbites, open bites, and gaps.

Treatment uses iTero® digital scans and a custom plan so you can preview movements. Patients typically wear aligners 20–22 hours per day and are seen about every six weeks for progress checks. Final retention with Vivera® or custom retainers helps protect results.

Severe bite or jaw discrepancies may require coordinated orthodontic and orthognathic surgery. We collaborate closely with surgeons to correct jaw position, relieve TMJ symptoms when present, and restore function and esthetics.

Early orthodontic guidance can sometimes prevent the need for surgery later. When surgery is necessary, we plan precisely to deliver predictable, life‑changing outcomes with a coordinated timeline of braces and surgical care.

After active treatment, custom retainers help keep teeth in their final positions. We provide clear removable retainers, Hawley retainers, and fixed/bonded retainers with care instructions for cleaning, wear, and storage to protect your results.

Our Retainer Protection Program offers long‑term coverage for replacements and repairs. Options include a comprehensive plan and a limited arch plan, with clear details on fees, copays, and terms to fit your needs.

We use state‑of‑the‑art digital tools to improve precision, comfort, and predictability across all treatments. Digital scanning, accelerated‑care devices, and advanced bracket systems help us deliver efficient, comfortable care.
Fast, radiation‑free 3D scans replace traditional impressions and feed directly into treatment planning and aligner fabrication for a more comfortable, precise experience.
PROPEL devices and the VPro/VPro+ adjuncts can stimulate bone remodeling to accelerate movement and help seat clear aligners, improving efficiency for many patients.
Damon Ultima™ is an advanced self‑ligating system that uses a sliding mechanism for lighter forces and fewer adjustments, designed for comfortable, efficient tooth movement.

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about orthodontic treatment, home care, scheduling, and patient forms at Frazier Orthodontics in River Forest, IL.
Orthodontics (also referred to as dentofacial orthopedics) is a specialized form of dentistry that focuses on the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of dental and facial abnormalities.

Orthodontists are specialists in moving teeth and aligning jaws. All orthodontists are dentists first; after dental school they complete an accredited orthodontic residency program, which involves two to three years of additional specialized training.

accordion.header: What’s the best age to visit the orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends that children first visit an orthodontist around age seven. Early evaluations let us monitor development and plan any needed treatment; orthodontic care is also common for teens and adults, with about one in five patients over age 21.

accordion.header: How can I take care of my teeth if I’m wearing braces or a retainer?

paragraphs.text: Always remember to brush your teeth after every meal and floss at least once a day. Use toothpaste that contains fluoride. Keep your retainer clean by brushing it gently and soaking as instructed. Avoid sugary, sticky, chewy, and very hard foods that can damage braces. Continue routine six-month dental checkups with your general dentist.

accordion.header: If I get braces, how long do I have to wear them?

paragraphs.text: Treatment times can take anywhere from six to 30 months, but most standard treatments last about 18–21 months. We’ll review a personalized timeline during your first appointment.

Braces generally should not hurt, however you may experience slight discomfort when the braces are first placed. It often takes a few days for your mouth to become accustomed to new appliances; over-the-counter pain relief and orthodontic wax can help during that time.

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

accordion.header: Do I need to brush my teeth more often if I have braces?

paragraphs.text: With braces, you should brush your teeth at least three times a day and floss daily to clean between brackets and wires. We will demonstrate the best brushing and flossing techniques when your braces are placed to help you keep your teeth healthy throughout treatment.

Everyday life with braces includes caring for appliances, protecting your mouth during sports, managing loose brackets or wires, and using orthodontic wax or pain relievers when needed. If you have an emergency, contact our office so we can advise you and schedule a timely repair.

accordion.header: What is DentalMonitoring and how does it work?

paragraphs.text: DentalMonitoring is a remote monitoring program that lets you send scans from home so we can review progress between appointments. It reduces in-office visits, helps us catch small issues early, and keeps treatment on schedule. Ask our team how to enroll and whether remote monitoring is right for your case.
